visualization_prompt: Create a Highcharts chartOptions object to render a chart with the following specifications: Chart type: areaspline, Chart title: '2022 Car's Fuel Consumption Ratings (City vs Highway Consumption)', Axes and labels styling: Use a dark blue color (#1E90FF) for the City Consumption series and an orange color (#ff8d1e) for the Highway Consumption series. The title font size should be 18px and the axis labels font size should be 12px. Data series: The data for the City Consumption series should be derived from the 'dataSource' array and the data for the Highway Consumption series should be derived from the 'dataSourceHighway' array. Both series should use a Gaussian Kernel Density Estimation (KDE) to smooth the data. Custom colors: Use the specified colors for the series. Additional configurations: Set the chart margins to 50px on all sides, add a subtitle with a link to the data source, and disable the markers for the series.

title.text:
2022 Car's Fuel Consumption Ratings
(City vs Highway Consumption)

visualization_explanation: The provided Highcharts chartOptions object is configured to render an 'areaspline' chart that visualizes the fuel consumption ratings of cars in 2022 for both city and highway driving conditions. The chart title is styled with a font size of 18px and the axis labels are styled with a font size of 12px. The 'City Consumption' series is colored in dark blue (#1E90FF) and the 'Highway Consumption' series is colored in orange (#ff8d1e). The data for both series is derived from the 'dataSource' and 'dataSourceHighway' arrays, respectively, and is smoothed using a Gaussian Kernel Density Estimation (KDE). The chart includes a subtitle with a link to the data source and has markers disabled for the series. The chart margins are set to 50px on all sides to provide adequate spacing around the chart.
